title: Can we stop calling the tank rework a fail ALREADY.
body:
These reworks change a lot of things. Sometimes these things are quite large, and need multiple patches to fix.

Sej is broken
Zac is sub-par
Maokai is a mage support

That doesnt mean riot purposefully did these things, and doesnt mean this is what they want. They all have their respective changes incoming, and will take several patches in order to fairly judge the results of the reworks.

So lets give it 2 months or so, and if the champions are still in general failures in their weak OR strong moments, THEN we can fairly judge the rework.

Stop jumping the gun and give it a bit before the world ends.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
EDIT

I am just gonna put this in as an edit so I don't keep repeating it:

You cannot tell what is balanceable / unhealthy. Without giving proper time to ATTEMPT balancing.

Done right you have a stack before you land (W1), a stack as you land (Auto), and a stack shortly after you land (W2).

> [{quoted}](name=BakedLotion,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=laMx0QP6,comment-id=000d,timestamp=2017-05-13T12:51:45.232+0000)

> Why did they rework champions that were fine when there are champions like Rammus/Malphite???

Because those Champions have problems that are too large to fix with a roster update. They wanted to fix Champions with minor issues and save Champions like Rammus and Malphite for visual/gameplay updates.

If intention was enough to constitute a success, then the concept of fail wouldn't exist.

It doesn't matter if Riot didn't intend this outcome, the thing is they did not achieve what they intended. And that is...a fail.

The big problem I have is that none of the reworks even made the champions better to play or fairer to play against.

Zac's rework just makes no sense at all considering he was already amongst the best designed in the class. His new ult is always going to feel worse than his old ult and his Q is the most 'whatever' change I've ever seen.

Maokai's rework is just as questionable, they really gave him nothing that would make him want to be a tank. They stuffed so much power into his brush camping, but ideally you want the highest damage you can for this so mage Maokai is just a logical consequence. Until they give him something to make him want to be a tank he will be a mage, even if his buildpath changes up a little it will probably still stay as a mage like MPen based build.

Sejuani's a clear example of Riot not understanding how to put together the pieces they had. Nothing on her kit is too individually garbage but Riot just made a few too many bad choices on her. They crammed all the power on her kit into her E and passive in her 20% max HP burst and ally interaction. In doing so they just made a kit that isn't that good to play, you just feel like an E/passive bot who's power is tied to their melee allies and who's other abilities only exist to serve E and passive. Your ult feels utterly abysmal and doesn't even feel like an ultimate and W only exists to stack E. This is made even more frustrating by the fact that her W is a well designed kit-linchpin ability. It feels like the sort of ability you'd want to design a kit around but is instead sidelined for her less interesting Braum-passive.

The item changes also aren't good, it doesn't take a genius to work this out. Tanks didn't get good new itemisation choices outside of maybe Adaptive Helm. They lost GA, Rand's, Cinder and Sunfire either entirely or to the realms of utter trash though. Don't even get me started on what they did to GA either, that's just an utterly terrible idea.

So yes, I do consider this midseason a failure already. There's just so much wrong with it. It felt like a rushed set of changes that noone really payed any time or attention to.
All class updates have been demonstrable failures so I didn't even have my hopes up high enough to feel let down

Mid season is a massive failure as far as I'm concerned.
 Changes to items to shove them so far into niches that they already covered which make them unviable. 

New items which either follow the niche property of the others and become near useless, or are so powerful that they are mandatory.

Zac with his confusing af q, maokai with his saplings, and sej with her e and passive. 

Plus no sources of true damage or pen in kits were nerfed despite the OBVIOUS fact that these champions would become so much more powerful.

And % hp scalings becoming much worse on average.

All of these things were explicit nerfs to tanks despite whatever riot tries to tell you and I hate it.
